definition: Departing from an accepted standard; abnormal or deviant
example: The student's aberrant behavior in class concerned the teacher.
The benevolent donor gave millions to local charities.
She presented a cogent argument for increasing the budget.
Smoking has deleterious effects on your health.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
example: The politician gave an eloquent speech that moved the audience.

definition: Treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor
example: His facetious comments during the meeting were not appreciated.

definition: Fond of the company of others; sociable
example: She's naturally gregarious and makes friends easily.
The movie was full of hackneyed plot devices.

definition: In accordance with the highest standards; faultless
example: Her impeccable manners impressed everyone at the dinner party.

definition: Having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense
example: The manager made a judicious decision to postpone the project.

definition: Relating to or resulting from motion
example: The kinetic energy of the moving car was tremendous.

definition: Displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion
example: The hot weather made everyone feel languid and tired.

definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
example: The scientist was meticulous in recording her observations.

definition: Feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed
example: Despite the chaos, he remained nonchalant about the situation.

definition: Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display
example: The ostentatious mansion was designed to impress visitors.
